documentclassifier
Class DocumentClassifierView

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.application.AbstractBean
      org.jdesktop.application.View
          org.jdesktop.application.FrameView
              documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, java.util.prefs.PreferenceChangeListener
public class DocumentClassifierView
extends org.jdesktop.application.FrameView
implements java.util.prefs.PreferenceChangeListener

This class represents the main frame of the application.

Author:
Salvo Danilo Giuffrida (giuffsalvo@hotmail.it, salvodanilogiuffrida@gmail.com)

openDocument

@Action
public void openDocument()
Action associated with the menù entry File->Open: It shows a JFileChooser, used to choose from the local filesystem a query document to classify.

readInputDocument

@Action(block=COMPONENT,
        enabledProperty="URLValid")
public org.jdesktop.application.Task readInputDocument()
Action, and associated background task, to extract the title and text from the document whose URL has been specified in the JTextField, and which represents the current query. The action is enabled only if the property 'indirizzoValido' is set "true", something that happens only if the JTextField of the URL is not empty.

Returns:
A reference to the background task associated with the action.

rankDocuments

@Action(block=COMPONENT,
        enabledProperty="documentRead")
public org.jdesktop.application.Task rankDocuments()
Action, and associated background task, to rank the documents of the training set to the current query document. The action is enabled only if the property 'documentRead' is set to "true", that is if the query document has been correctly read from the URL provided in the JTextField.

Returns:
A reference to the background task associated with the action.

Validation

@Action(block=WINDOW)
public org.jdesktop.application.Task Validation()
Action, and associated background task, to perform K-Fold cross validation on all pages of the training set, in order to determine the optimal value of K for the K-NN. The task blocks the current window, and automatically shows a JOptionPane which, together with the appropriate text area at the bottom of the main window, informs the user on the state of the computation.

Returns:
Reference to the background task associated with this action.
